meanings.definition: A tax rate expressed in mills per dollar.
meanings.sent1: The millage in our town is 50 mills per dollar.
meanings.sent2: The school district increased the millage to fund new programs.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that the millage was so high, even the birds had to pay taxes!
meanings.sent4: The millage hung over the town like a dark cloud, burdening everyone with extra costs.
meanings.sent5: The millage was like a hungry monster, devouring everyone's hard-earned money.

meanings.sent1: The millage of sugar in the recipe was two cups per thousand units of flour.
meanings.sent2: The millage of cars on the highway increased during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally added a millage of salt to the soup, making it taste like the ocean!
meanings.sent4: The millage of stars in the night sky was breathtaking, like a blanket of diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The millage of books in the library was overwhelming, with thousands of titles to choose from.
